sequence: <size=51><I wonder if something like that white whale, Moby Dick, really existed...></size>
<size=51><Yes, that story of the men who chased after it, a story filled with their expectations, their hope and their despair.></size>
<size=51><But we are not like them. In our story, there is no doubt that Moby Dick will be found.></size>
<size=51><After all, our story would never end if that was not the case.></size>
<size=51><And all good stories - whether comedy or tragedy - must have closure.></size>

scripts.say: Combat Zone - Bermuda Triangle
Ugh... We've been had...! This was the Sirens' trap after all!
Victorious! Shangri-La!
We've lost communication with Task Force 11 and Task Force 17!
The enemies are several times more numerous than the intelligence report claimed.
We've been completely surrounded...
KABOOM---!!
NY City - Wharf
I must first extend my gratitude to each and every one of you for arriving in such a timely manner. I'll now explain the next phase of the operation.
As we all know, the Sirens laid siege to NY City just a week ago. Currently, many of our port facilities are still disabled from the attack.
However, due to the tenacity of our brave defenders and Commander's effective leadership, the damages ended up being a lot lighter than they could have been.
During the time of the attack, many of us, including Cleveland and myself, were unable to come to the defense of the harbor due to jamming of our communication networks.
In addition, we cannot ignore the reality that the Sirens managed to disable and bypass our radar system.
Given the status quo, the harsh reality is that we cannot deal with another potential large-scale attack from the Sirens.
As such, Headquarters has submitted a proposal - that we take the fight to the Sirens' forward base instead of waiting for our destruction. Commander has accepted this as our best plan of action.
We've determined that the most likely location for the Sirens' forward base is in the Bermuda Triangle.
There is ample evidence to support this conclusion. When the Sirens' attack began, a dark cloud was spotted forming over that area, covering the surface of the ocean.
Additionally, strong electromagnetic readings have been detected from that area, similar to when the "Winter's Crown" formed near the Northern Parliament.

Given what we know about the Winter's Crown, and the enormous manpower it took to suppress that situation, we can conclude that if a similar situation were to occur here, NY City would be in grave peril.
The primary goals of our operation are to find and destroy the Sirens' main base, secure the maritime routes around NY City, and finally...
Victorious, please explain what a "singularity" is.
I am Victorious, a carrier from the Royal Navy. I accompanied Commander to NY City in order to participate in a strategic meeting. Some of you might know me as "Robin."
Anyways...! I'm a representative of the Royal Navy. During this operation, I will be joining as an advisor.
Ahem... Victorious...
Ack! My apologies!
Um, the Winter's Crown... The best way to describe it is as an area of anomalous weather, similar to the Mirror Seas. I first encountered one during an operation in the north.

Even from a distance, we experienced significant electromagnetic disruption to our communications equipment. About half our fleet lost radio contact temporarily, and a variety of other electronic equipment was also affected.
Without being able to utilise radar, it became very difficult for us to control our aircraft. We had to rely on experience - and at times, sheer luck.
We attempted to conduct reconnaissance operations inside the Crown, but we would lose our seaplanes as soon as they entered, as if they were getting absorbed the expanding cloud.
However, what we see here in the Bermuda Triangle is slightly different.
We are still able to see into the area, meaning that we will be able to visually confirm any combat that happens inside.
In other words, we will approach from here⁠—
If we destroy the core, we will be able to stop a full-fledged singularity from forming.
In this mission, Essex, Baltimore, and I will each lead a fleet into the Bermuda Triangle.
Our final objective is to stop this singularity from forming!
In addition, Commander will directly be leading us from one of the ships, actively supporting our efforts on the front line.
Everyone, I wish you the best of luck.
